page.title: 10LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: The Local Government is the parish council. They are elected every four years by voting from the village people There are nine councillors who meet at least once a month to discuss what the people want. One thing that they have to decide is where to put the street lights. If somebody said that a street light ought to be put along a dark road the council would have a meeting. They would have to decide whether to put a street light there. If people have a problem they can take it to the Parish Council who can speak for them and tell the District or the County Council what is needed to be done. and if it is necessary they will pass it on. Written by Christopher Calvert
